result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation
PLEA QUESTIONNAIRE/WAIVER OF RIGHTS
DAGP agreement

11:17 AM cases 22CF137, 22CF723 called. Defendant Trista M Wickware in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Trista M Wickware.  Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
There is an agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1 as charged in the Information in 22CF137. Court accepts plea but withholds a finding of Guilt. 
A 2 year DAGP agreement is filed with and accepted by the Court. Forty hours community service as part of DAGP agreement.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 19, 2024 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Hillestad requests to schedule a plea hearing a few months out.
